de.esoco.process

Class StepListProcessDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
        • de.esoco.process.ProcessDefinition
          • de.esoco.process.StepListProcessDefinition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.manage.ElementDefinition<Process>, java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionHandlingProcessDefinition, EntityProcessDefinition, XMLProcessDefinition

    public class StepListProcessDefinition
extends ProcessDefinition
    Defines a process from a sequential list of process steps. The order in the list will be considered as the general order in which the process steps will be performed as long as no other order is defined in the step instances.

    Some of the methods that add process steps (e.g. branchTo()) will enumerate the step name if it occurs multiple times to prevent name clashes. If a process definition needs to refer to such a step's name (e.g. to add a branch to it) it must query the name of the returned step list entry.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • StepListProcessDefinition

        public StepListProcessDefinition(java.lang.String sProcessName,
                                 StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry... rStepList)
        Convenience constructor with a variable argument list.
        See Also:
        StepListProcessDefinition(String, List)

      • StepListProcessDefinition

        public StepListProcessDefinition(java.lang.String sProcessName,
                                 java.util.List<StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry> rStepList)
        Creates a new process definition for a specific process name and a list of process steps. The sequential order of the steps in the list will be used as the order in which the steps will be performed, unless a step already contains a different next step reference. Especially the first and the last steps in the list will be used as the starting and ending steps of the process, respectively.
        Parameters:
        sProcessName - The name of the process described by this definition
        rStepList - The sequential list of process steps
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the process step list is empty

        A subclass constructor that creates a process definition that has the same name as the subclass.

      • StepListProcessDefinition

        protected StepListProcessDefinition(java.lang.String sProcessName)
        A subclass constructor that creates a new process definition with a certain name. The process steps must be added later through the method invoke(String, Class).
        Parameters:
        sProcessName - The name of the process created by this definition or NULL for the class name

      • branchTo

        protected <T> StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry branchTo(java.lang.Class<? extends ProcessFragment> rTargetStepClass,
                                                               org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rBranchParam,
                                                               de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super T> pBranchCondition,

      • branchTo

        protected <T> StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry branchTo(java.lang.String sTargetStep,
                                                               org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rBranchParam,
                                                               de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super T> pBranchCondition,
                                                               java.lang.String sName)
        Adds a step that branches the process flow. If a process contains multiple branches to the same target step the names of the branch steps will be enumerated to ensure uniqueness. If a process definition needs to refer to a branch step's name (e.g. for another branch to the step itself) it should query the name of the returned step list entry.
        Parameters:
        sTargetStep - The name of the target step to be executed if the branch condition is TRUE; to end the process it must be Process.PROCESS_END
        rBranchParam - The parameter to be evaluated for the branch
        pBranchCondition - The predicate to evaluate the branch parameter with
        sName - The name of the step
        Returns:
        The new step list entry

      • copyParam

        protected <T> StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry copyParam(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rSourceParam,
                                                                org.obrel.core.RelationType<? super T> rTargetParam)
        Adds a step to that copies a process parameter to another parameter. A unique step name will be generated automatically. If an application needs to refer to this step by it's name it must query the name of the returned step list entry.
        Parameters:
        rSourceParam - The source parameter to copy
        rTargetParam - The target parameter
        Returns:
        The new step list entry

      • displayMessage

        protected StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry displayMessage(java.lang.String sMessage,
                                                                 java.lang.String sInfo,
                                                                 boolean bAutoContinue)
        Adds a process step of type DisplayMessage that displays a message and an option information string. If the boolean parameter is true the step will automatically continue to the next step. This can be used to display a wait message for subsequent steps that take long time. The message will then be displayed until the next interaction occurs in the process.
        Parameters:
        sMessage - The message to display
        sInfo - The information string or NULL for none
        bAutoContinue - TRUE to automatically continue to the next step
        Returns:
        The new step list entry

      • handleFragmentContinuation

        @SafeVarargs
protected final StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry handleFragmentContinuation(java.lang.Class<? extends ProcessFragment> rAfterHandlingStep,
                                                                                                 java.lang.Class<? extends ProcessFragment> rNoHandlingStep,
                                                                                                 java.lang.Class<? extends ProcessDefinition>... rFragmentHandlingProcesses)
        Inserts the steps that are needed to handle the continuation parameters of interaction fragments. If a continuation occurred and it can be associated with an interaction fragment the corresponding handling processes will be invoked. Afterwards the process will jump to the given after-handling process step. If no continuation fragment can be found the process will jump to the given no-handling step or, if that is NULL, to the process end.

        To determine the fragment classes that must be checked against the current continuation fragment class (which is stored in the parameter ProcessRelationTypes.CONTINUATION_FRAGMENT_CLASS) the enclosing classes of the fragment handling processes will be used. That means that fragment handling processes must always be defined as a direct inner class of the fragment they define the continuation handling of.

        Parameters:
        rAfterHandlingStep - The process step to be invoked after a fragment handling process
        rNoHandlingStep - The process step to be invoked if no fragment handling has occurred
        rFragmentHandlingProcesses - The list of fragment continuation handling processes
        Returns:
        The StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry of the first continuation handling step

      • initParam

        protected <S,D> void initParam(org.obrel.core.RelationType<S> rSourceParam,
                               org.obrel.core.RelationType<D> rDestinationParam,
                               de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super S,D> fInit)
        Adds a conditional parameter initialization function that produces the value of a certain parameter from the process. The function will only be evaluated if the given source parameter is not NULL. Therefore the argument function doesn't need to check the parameter existence by itself.
        Parameters:
        rSourceParam - The process parameter to evaluate with the initialization function
        rDestinationParam - The process parameter to store the function result in
        fInit - A function that produces the parameter value from the process

      • invokeBinaryFunction

        protected <L,R,O> StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry invokeBinaryFunction(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                               org.obrel.core.RelationType<L> rLeftParam,
                                                                               org.obrel.core.RelationType<R> rRightParam,
                                                                               org.obrel.core.RelationType<O> rOutputParam,
                                                                               de.esoco.lib.expression.BinaryFunction<? super L,? super R,? extends O> rFunction)
        Adds an instance of FunctionStep for a step that evaluates a binary function on certain parameters. If multiple steps with the same name are added the names of the additional steps will be enumerated to ensure uniqueness.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the interactive step
        rLeftParam - The type of the parameter that contains the main (left-side) input value for the function evaluation
        rRightParam - The type of the parameter that contains the secondary (right-side) input value for the evaluation of the binary function
        rOutputParam - The type of the parameter to store the output value of the function evaluation in or NULL to ignore the function output
        rFunction - The binary function that the step shall evaluate
        Returns:
        The new step list entry

      • invokeFunction

        protected <I,O> StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry invokeFunction(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                       org.obrel.core.RelationType<I> rInputParam,
                                                                       org.obrel.core.RelationType<O> rOutputParam,
                                                                       de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super I,? extends O> rFunction)
        Adds an instance of FunctionStep for a step that evaluates a function on a certain parameter. If multiple steps with the same name are added the names of the additional steps will be enumerated to ensure uniqueness.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the interactive step
        rInputParam - The type of the parameter that contains the input value for the function evaluation or NULL for no input value (for functions that ignore their input)
        rOutputParam - The type of the parameter to store the output value of the function evaluation in or NULL to ignore the function output
        rFunction - The function that the step shall evaluate
        Returns:
        The new step list entry

      • invokeSubProcess

        protected StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry invokeSubProcess(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                   java.lang.Class<? extends ProcessDefinition> rSubProcessClass)
        Adds a step for a sub-process invocation with a specific name. This method should only be used for sub-process that need a different name than their definition (e.g. for multiple invocations from the same parent process). If this is not the case the invokeSubProcess(Class) method should be used instead.
        Parameters:
        sName - The step name or NULL to use the name of the sub-process
        rSubProcessClass - The class of the sub-process definition
        Returns:
        The new step list entry

      • switchOnParam

        protected <T> StepListProcessDefinition.StepListEntry switchOnParam(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rSwitchParam,
                                                                    de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super T,java.lang.Object> fTargetSelector)
